author: Lee Scott

review: The streaming video part of it is fine. A good option if you have no access to a set-top streaming player of some kind. The background screen images are pretty.The biggest negative for me is that once your phone/laptop/tablet goes into sleep mode, power saving mode, or otherwise goes dark, you can no longer control the player or the video (no pause, rewind, etc.).  The only way to stop the streaming and regain control is to unplug Chromecast and start over.  In the sales pitch, Google doesn't mention it. They save that tidbit for the support forum, after you've purchased it: "Playback controls can't be used after the video player has been closed," as when your device auto-locks or auto-sleeps.  I suppose you could plugin your device and keep it from going to sleep...but if you're going to plug something in, it may as well be a set-top player.
